Race.SpecificTitle: Constable(s) -- Justice of the Peace Ward  4
Parishwide Proposition -- 0.40% S&U Tax - PC - 7 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of 0.40% (the "Tax") (an estimated $22,240,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Parish, all as defined by law, for a period of 7 years, beginning January 1, 2022, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used solely for the purpose of funding the Parish's state-mandated responsibilities to various governmental agencies, including (i) the Sheriff's Office for parish prisoners and maintaining jail facilities, (ii) the District Attorney's Office, (iii) the 22nd Judicial District Court and (iv) required maintenance and operations of the justice center complex?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 12 Prop. No. 1 of 4 -- 4.42 Mills Renewal - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 12 Proposition No. 1 of 4
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Wide School District No. 12 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana, continue to levy a four and forty-two hundredths (4.42) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $10,523,904 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of giving additional support to the public schools of said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 12 Prop. No. 2 of 4 -- 32.41 Mills Renewal - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 12 Proposition No. 2 of 4
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Wide School District No. 12 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana, continue to levy a thirty-two and forty-one hundredths (32.41) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $77,167,383 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of giving additional support for improving, maintaining and operating the public elementary and secondary school system of said Parish, the net proceeds of said tax to be dedicated and allocated as follows: (i) 56.5% for the payment of employee wages and benefits, (ii) 28.5% for the payment of costs incurred in connection with the enhancement of the curriculum and improvement of the instructional program of said school system and (iii) 15% for payment for janitorial services and expenses, utilities and other costs of operating and maintaining said school system?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 12 Prop. No. 3 of 4 -- 3.14 Mills Renewal - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 12 Proposition No. 3 of 4
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Wide School District No. 12 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana, continue to levy a three and fourteen hundredths (3.14) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $7,476,263 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and operating schools and school related facilities in said School District and for the payment of wages and benefits, including retirement, of employees of the St. Tammany Parish School Board?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 12 Prop. No. 4 of 4 -- 2.75 Mills Renewal - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 12 Proposition No. 4 of 4
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Wide School District No. 12 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana, continue to levy a two and seventy-five hundredths (2.75) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $6,547,705 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of 10 years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of providing additional support to the public school system of said Parish, including, but not limited to, payment of wages and benefits, including retirement, of employees of the St. Tammany Parish School Board?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Mandeville Prop. No. 1 of 2 -- 5.08 Mills Renewal - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Mandeville Proposition No. 1 of 2
(Police Department Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Mandeville, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy a special tax of five and eight hundredths (5.08) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $1,145,484 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2022 and ending with the year 2031, for the purpose of providing additional funds for operating and maintaining the police department of said City, including the payment of salaries and benefits of police personnel?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Mandeville Prop. No. 2 of 2 -- 3.38 Mills Renewal - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Mandeville Proposition No. 2 of 2 
(Police Department Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Mandeville, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy a special tax of three and thirty-eight hundredths (3.38) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $762,153 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2022 and ending with the year 2031, for the purpose of providing additional funds for operating and maintaining the police department of said City, including the payment of salaries and benefits of police personnel?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No. 11 -- 10 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall St. Tammany Parish Recreation District No. 11, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $730,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities in said District, together with the necessary furnishings and equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 7 -- 10 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of St. Tammany, Louisiana (the "District"), levy a tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $487,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2022 and ending with the year 2031, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating fire protection and emergency medical service facilities, vehicles and equipment, including movable and immovable property, to be used by the District directly or indirectly to provide fire protection and emergency medical services in and for the District?
